meanings.definition: (verb) (of a horse) to make a soft, low sound
meanings.sent1: The horse began to whicker softly as it greeted its owner.
meanings.sent2: I heard the horse whicker as I approached the stable.
meanings.sent3: The horse tried to whicker a secret to the other animals in the barn.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to whicker through the trees, creating a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: The whickering of the horse echoed through the quiet countryside.

meanings.definition: (noun) a soft, low sound made by a horse
meanings.sent1: The whicker of the horse was a comforting sound in the peaceful meadow.
meanings.sent2: I recognized the familiar whicker of my favorite horse from afar.
meanings.sent3: The whicker of the horse seemed to blend with the rustling of the leaves.
meanings.sent4: The whicker of the horse was like a gentle lullaby in the evening.
meanings.sent5: The whicker of the horse brought a sense of tranquility to the farm.
